   19: %%
   20: -module(erlc_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Tests the erlc command by compiling various types of files.
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   26:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   27:          compile_erl/1,
   28:          compile_yecc/1, compile_script/1,
   29:          compile_mib/1, good_citizen/1, deep_cwd/1, arg_overflow/1,
   30:          make_dep_options/1,
   31:          features_erlc_describe/1,
   32:          features_erlc_unknown/1,
   33:          features_directives/1,
   34:          features_atom_warnings/1,
   35:          features_macros/1,
   36:          features_disable/1,
   37:          features_all/1,
   38:          features_load/1,
   39:          features_runtime/1,
   40:          features_include/1,
   41:          features/1]).
   42: 
   43: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   44: 
   45: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   46: 
   47: all() ->
   48:     [{group,with_server},{group,without_server},
   49:      {group,features_with_server}].
   50: 
   51: groups() ->
   52:     Tests = tests(),
   53:     [{with_server,[],Tests},
   54:      {features_with_server,[],feature_tests()},
   55:      {without_server,[],Tests ++ feature_tests()}].
   56: 
   57: tests() ->
   58:     [compile_erl, compile_yecc, compile_script, compile_mib,
   59:      good_citizen, deep_cwd, arg_overflow, make_dep_options].
   60: 
   61: feature_tests() ->
   62:     [features_erlc_describe,
   63:      features_erlc_unknown,
   64:      features_directives,
   65:      features_atom_warnings,
   66:      features_macros,
   67:      features_disable,
   68:      features_all,
   69:      features_load,
   70:      features_runtime,
   71:      features_include,
   72:      features].
   73: 
   74: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   75:     Config.
   76: 
   77: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   78:     ok.
   79: 
   80: init_per_group(with_server, Config) ->
   81:     os:putenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER", "yes"),
   82:     Config;
   83: init_per_group(features_with_server, Config) ->
   84:     os:putenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER", "yes"),
   85:     timer:sleep(12 * 1000),
   86:     Config;
   87: init_per_group(without_server, Config) ->
   88:     os:putenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER", "no"),
   89:     Config;
   90: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
   91:     Config.
   92: 
   93: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   94:     os:unsetenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER"),
   95:     os:unsetenv("OTP_TEST_FEATURES"),
   96:     Config.
   97: 
   98: init_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
   99:     case lists:member(TestCase, feature_tests()) of
  100:         true ->
  101:             os:putenv("OTP_TEST_FEATURES", "true");
  102:         false ->
  103:             ok
  104:         end,
  105:     Config.
  106: 
  107: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  108:     case lists:member(TestCase, feature_tests()) of
  109:         true ->
  110:             os:putenv("OTP_TEST_FEATURES", "true");
  111:         false ->
  112:             ok
  113:         end,
  114:     Config.
  115: 
  116: 
  117: %% Copy from erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test.hrl.
  118: 
  119: -record(person, {name, shoe_size}).
  120: 
  121: %% Tests that compiling Erlang source code works.
  122: 
  123: compile_erl(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  124:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  125:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief",
  126:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_ok.erl"),
  127: 
  128:     %% By default, warnings are now turned on.
  129:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "",
  130:         ["Warning: function foo/0 is unused\$", "_OK_"]),
  131: 
  132:     %% Test that the compiled file is where it should be,
  133:     %% and that it is runnable.
  134: 
  135:     {module, erl_test_ok} = code:load_abs(filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok")),
  136:     42 = erl_test_ok:shoe_size(#person{shoe_size=42}),
  137:     code:purge(erl_test_ok),
  138: 
  139:     %% Try disabling warnings.
  140: 
  141:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W0", ["_OK_"]),
  142: 
  143:     %% Try treating warnings as errors.
  144: 
  145:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-Werror",
  146:         ["compile: warnings being treated as errors\$",
  147:          "function foo/0 is unused\$", "_ERROR_"]),
  148: 
  149:     %% Check a bad file.
  150: 
  151:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_bad.erl"),
  152:     run(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "", ["function non_existing/1 undefined\$",
  153:                                    "_ERROR_"]),
  154:     ok.
  155: 
  156: %% Test that compiling yecc source code works.
  157: 
  158: compile_yecc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  159:     {SrcDir, _, OutDir} = get_dirs(Config),
  160:     Cmd = erlc() ++ " -o" ++ OutDir ++ " ",
  161:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "yecc_test_ok.yrl"),
  162:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W0", ["_OK_"]),
  163:     true = exists(filename:join(OutDir, "yecc_test_ok.erl")),
  164: 
  165:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "yecc_test_bad.yrl"),
  166:     run(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "-W0",
  167:         ["Nonterminals is missing\$",
  168:          "rootsymbol form is not a nonterminal\$",
  169:          "undefined nonterminal: form\$",
  170:          "_ERROR_"]),
  171:     exists(filename:join(OutDir, "yecc_test_ok.erl")),
  172:     ok.
  173: 
  174: %% Test that compiling start scripts works.
  175: 
  176: compile_script(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  177:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd} = get_cmd(Config),
  178:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "start_ok.script"),
  179:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "", ["_OK_"]),
  180:     true = exists(filename:join(OutDir, "start_ok.boot")),
  181: 
  182:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "start_bad.script"),
  183:     run(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "", ["syntax error before:", "_ERROR_"]),
  184:     ok.
  185: 
  186: %% Test that compiling SNMP mibs works.
  187: 
  188: compile_mib(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  189:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd} = get_cmd(Config),
  190:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "GOOD-MIB.mib"),
  191:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "", ["_OK_"]),
  192:     Output = filename:join(OutDir, "GOOD-MIB.bin"),
  193:     true = exists(Output),
  194: 
  195:     %% Try -W option.
  196: 
  197:     ok = file:delete(Output),
  198:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W",
  199:         ["_OK_"]),
  200:     true = exists(Output),
  201: 
  202:     %% Try -W option and more verbose.
  203: 
  204:     ok = file:delete(Output),
  205:     case os:type() of
  206:         {unix,_} ->
  207:             run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W +'{verbosity,info}'",
  208:                 ["\\[GOOD-MIB[.]mib\\]\\[INF\\]: No accessfunction for 'sysDescr' => using default",
  209:                  "_OK_"]),
  210:             true = exists(Output),
  211:             ok = file:delete(Output);
  212:         _ -> ok				%Don't bother -- too much work.
  213:     end,
  214: 
  215:     %% Try a bad file.
  216: 
  217:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "BAD-MIB.mib"),
  218:     run(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "",
  219:         ["BAD-MIB.mib: 1: syntax error before: mibs\$",
  220:          "compilation_failed_ERROR_"]),
  221: 
  222:     %% Make sure that no -I option works.
  223: 
  224:     NewCmd = erlc() ++ " -o" ++ OutDir ++ " ",
  225:     run(Config, NewCmd, FileName, "", ["_OK_"]),
  226:     true = exists(Output),
  227: 
  228:     ok.
  229: 
  230: %% Checks that 'erlc' doesn't eat any input (important when called from a
  231: %% shell script with redirected input).
  232: good_citizen(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  233:     case os:type() of
  234:         {unix, _} ->
  235:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  236:             Answer = filename:join(PrivDir, "answer"),
  237:             Script = filename:join(PrivDir, "test_script"),
  238:             Test = filename:join(PrivDir, "test.erl"),
  239:             S = ["#! /bin/sh\n", "erlc ", Test, "\n",
  240:                  "read reply\n", "echo $reply\n"],
  241:             ok = file:write_file(Script, S),
  242:             ok = file:write_file(Test, "-module(test).\n"),
  243:             Cmd = "echo y | sh " ++ Script ++ " > " ++ Answer,
  244:             os:cmd(Cmd),
  245:             {ok, Answer0} = file:read_file(Answer),
  246:             [$y|_] = binary_to_list(Answer0),
  247:             ok;
  248:         _ ->
  249:             {skip, "Unix specific"}
  250:     end.
  251: 
  252: %% Make sure that compiling an Erlang module deep down in
  253: %% in a directory with more than 255 characters works.
  254: deep_cwd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  255:     case os:type() of
  256:         {unix, _} ->
  257:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  258:             deep_cwd_1(PrivDir);
  259:         _ ->
  260:             {skip, "Only a problem on Unix"}
  261:     end.
  262: 
  263: deep_cwd_1(PrivDir) ->
  264:     DeepDir0 = filename:join(PrivDir, lists:duplicate(128, $a)),
  265:     DeepDir = filename:join(DeepDir0, lists:duplicate(128, $b)),
  266:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(DeepDir,"any_file")),
  267:     ok = file:set_cwd(DeepDir),
  268:     ok = file:write_file("test.erl", "-module(test).\n\n"),
  269:     io:format("~s\n", [os:cmd("erlc test.erl")]),
  270:     true = filelib:is_file("test.beam"),
  271:     ok.
  272: 
  273: %% Test that a large number of command line switches does not
  274: %% overflow the argument buffer
  275: arg_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  276:     {SrcDir, _OutDir, Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  277:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief",
  278:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_ok.erl"),
  279:     %% Each -D option will be expanded to three arguments when
  280:     %% invoking 'erl'.
  281:     NumDOptions = num_d_options(),
  282:     Args = lists:flatten([ ["-D", integer_to_list(N, 36), "=1 "] ||
  283:                            N <- lists:seq(1, NumDOptions) ]),
  284:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, Args,
  285:         ["Warning: function foo/0 is unused\$",
  286:          "_OK_"]),
  287:     ok.
  288: 
  289: num_d_options() ->
  290:     case {os:type(),os:version()} of
  291:         {{win32,_},_} ->
  292:             %% The maximum size of a command line in the command
  293:             %% shell on Windows is 8191 characters.
  294:             %% Each -D option is expanded to "@dv NN 1", i.e.
  295:             %% 8 characters. (Numbers up to 1295 can be expressed
  296:             %% as two 36-base digits.)
  297:             1000;
  298:         {{unix,linux},Version} when Version < {2,6,23} ->
  299:             %% On some older 64-bit versions of Linux, the maximum number
  300:             %% of arguments is 16383.
  301:             %% See: http://www.in-ulm.de/~mascheck/various/argmax/
  302:             5440;
  303:         {{unix,darwin},{Major,_,_}} when Major >= 11 ->
  304:             %% "getconf ARG_MAX" still reports 262144 (as in previous
  305:             %% version of MacOS X), but the useful space seem to have
  306:             %% shrunk significantly (or possibly the number of arguments).
  307:             %% 7673
  308:             7500;
  309:         {_,_} ->
  310:             12000
  311:     end.
  312: 
  313: erlc() ->
  314:     case os:find_executable("erlc") of
  315:         false ->
  316:             ct:fail("Can't find erlc");
  317:         Erlc ->
  318:             "\"" ++ Erlc ++ "\""
  319:     end.
  320: 
  321: make_dep_options(Config) ->
  322:     {SrcDir,OutDir,Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  323:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief",
  324:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_ok.erl"),
  325:     BeamFileName = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.beam"),
  326: 
  327:     DepRE = ["/erl_test_ok[.]beam: \\\\$",
  328:              "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok[.]erl \\\\$",
  329:              "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl$",
  330:              "_OK_"],
  331: 
  332:     DepRETarget =
  333:     ["^target: \\\\$",
  334:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok[.]erl \\\\$",
  335:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl$",
  336:      "_OK_"],
  337: 
  338:     DepREMP =
  339:     ["/erl_test_ok[.]beam: \\\\$",
  340:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok[.]erl \\\\$",
  341:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl$",
  342:      [],
  343:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test.hrl:$",
  344:      "_OK_"],
  345: 
  346:     DepREMissing =
  347:     ["/erl_test_missing_header[.]beam: \\\\$",
  348:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_missing_header[.]erl \\\\$",
  349:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl \\\\$",
  350:      "missing.hrl$",
  351:      "_OK_"],
  352: 
  353:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  354: 
  355:     %% Test plain -M
  356:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M", DepRE),
  357:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  358: 
  359:     %% Test -MF File
  360:     DepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "my.deps"),
  361:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MF "++DepFile, ["_OK_"]),
  362:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(DepFile),
  363:     verify_result(binary_to_list(MFBin)++["_OK_"], DepRE),
  364:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  365: 
  366:     %% Test -MD
  367:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MD", ["_OK_"]),
  368:     MDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  369:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(MDFile),
  370:     file:delete(MDFile), %% used further down!
  371:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  372: 
  373:     %% Test -M -MT Target
  374:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M -MT target", DepRETarget),
  375:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  376: 
  377:     %% Test -MF File -MT Target
  378:     TargetDepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "target.deps"),
  379:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MF "++TargetDepFile++" -MT target",
  380:         ["_OK_"]),
  381:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetDepFile),
  382:     verify_result(binary_to_list(TargetBin)++["_OK_"], DepRETarget),
  383:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  384:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  385: 
  386:     %% Test -MD -MT Target
  387:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MD -MT target", ["_OK_"]),
  388:     TargetMDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  389:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetMDFile),
  390:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  391:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  392: 
  393:     %% Test -M -MQ Target. (Note: Passing a $ on the command line
  394:     %% portably for Unix and Windows is tricky, so we will just test
  395:     %% that MQ works at all.)
  396:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M -MQ target", DepRETarget),
  397:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  398: 
  399:     %% Test -M -MP
  400:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M -MP", DepREMP),
  401:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  402: 
  403:     %% Test -M -MG
  404:     MissingHeader = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_missing_header.erl"),
  405:     run(Config, Cmd, MissingHeader, "-M -MG", DepREMissing),
  406:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  407: 
  408:     %%
  409:     %% check the above variants with side-effect -MMD
  410:     %%
  411: 
  412:     %% since compiler is run on the erlang code a warning will be
  413:     %% issued by the compiler, match that.
  414:     WarningRE =
  415:          "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok.erl:[0-9]+:[0-9]+: "
  416:         "Warning: function foo/0 is unused$",
  417:     ErrorRE = "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_missing_header.erl:"
  418:         "[0-9]+:[0-9]+: can't find include file \"missing.hrl\"$",
  419: 
  420:     DepRE_MMD = insert_before("_OK_", WarningRE, DepRE),
  421:     DepRETarget_MMD = insert_before("_OK_", WarningRE, DepRETarget),
  422:     DepREMP_MMD = insert_before("_OK_",WarningRE,DepREMP),
  423:     DepREMissing_MMD = (insert_before("_OK_",ErrorRE,DepREMissing)--
  424:                             ["_OK_"]) ++ ["_ERROR_"],
  425:     CompRE = [WarningRE,"_OK_"],
  426: 
  427: 
  428:     %% Test plain -MMD -M
  429:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M", DepRE_MMD),
  430:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  431:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  432: 
  433:     %% Test -MMD -MF File
  434:     DepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "my.deps"),
  435:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MF "++DepFile, CompRE),
  436:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(DepFile),
  437:     verify_result(binary_to_list(MFBin)++["_OK_"], DepRE),
  438:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  439:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  440: 
  441:     %% Test -MMD -MD
  442:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MD", CompRE),
  443:     MDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  444:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(MDFile),
  445:     file:delete(MDFile), %% used further down!
  446:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  447:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  448: 
  449:     %% Test -MMD -M -MT Target
  450:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M -MT target", DepRETarget_MMD),
  451:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  452:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  453: 
  454:     %% Test -MMD -MF File -MT Target
  455:     TargetDepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "target.deps"),
  456:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MF "++TargetDepFile++" -MT target",
  457:         CompRE),
  458:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetDepFile),
  459:     verify_result(binary_to_list(TargetBin)++["_OK_"], DepRETarget),
  460:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  461:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  462:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  463: 
  464:     %% Test -MMD -MD -MT Target
  465:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MD -MT target", CompRE),
  466:     TargetMDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  467:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetMDFile),
  468:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  469:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  470:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  471: 
  472:     %% Test -MMD -M -MQ Target. (Note: Passing a $ on the command line
  473:     %% portably for Unix and Windows is tricky, so we will just test
  474:     %% that MQ works at all.)
  475:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M -MQ target", DepRETarget_MMD),
  476:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  477:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  478: 
  479:     %% Test -MMD -M -MP
  480:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M -MP", DepREMP_MMD),
  481:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  482:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  483: 
  484:     %% Test -MMD -M -MG
  485:     MissingHeader = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_missing_header.erl"),
  486:     run(Config, Cmd, MissingHeader, "-MMD -M -MG", DepREMissing_MMD),
  487:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  488:     ok.
  489: 
  490: 
  491: %%% Tests related to the features mechanism
  492: %% Support macros and functions
  493: -define(OK(Lines), Lines ++ ["_OK_"]).
  494: -define(NOTOK(Lines), Lines ++ ["_ERROR_"]).
  495: 
  496: flatfmt(FStr, Args) ->
  497:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format(FStr, Args)).
  498: 
  499: defopt(Name) -> flatfmt("-D~w", [Name]).
  500: defopt(Name, Value) -> flatfmt("-D~w=~w", [Name, Value]).
  501: 
  502: longopt(enable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("-enable-feature ~w", [Ftr]);
  503: longopt(disable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("-disable-feature ~w", [Ftr]).
  504: 
  505: plusopt(enable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("+\"{feature, ~w, enable}\"", [Ftr]);
  506: plusopt(disable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("+\"{feature, ~w, disable}\"", [Ftr]).
  507: 
  508: options(Opts) -> lists:flatten(lists:join(" ", Opts)).
  509: 
  510: peer(Args) ->
  511:     {ok, Peer, Node} =
  512:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args,
  513:                    connection => 0}),
  514:     {Peer, Node}.
  515: 
  516: %% Error messages to expect
  517: nosingle(Ftr) -> flatfmt("the feature '~w' does not exist", [Ftr]).
  518: 
  519: nomultiple(Ftrs) ->
  520:     Q = fun(A) -> flatfmt("'~w'", [A]) end,
  521:     flatfmt("the features ~s and '~w' do not exist",
  522:             [lists:join(", ",
  523:                         lists:map(Q, lists:droplast(Ftrs))),
  524:              lists:last(Ftrs)]).
  525: 
  526: not_config(Ftr) -> flatfmt("the feature '~w' is not configurable", [Ftr]).
  527: 
  528: syntax(Offender) -> flatfmt("syntax error before: ~w", [Offender]).
  529: 
  530: misplaced_directive() ->
  531:     "feature directive not allowed after exports or record definitions".
  532: 
  533: atom_warning(Atom, Ftr) ->
  534:     flatfmt("atom '~w' is reserved in the experimental feature '~w'",
  535:             [Atom, Ftr]).
  536: 
  537: compile_fun(Config) ->
  538:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd} = get_cmd(Config),
  539:     Compile = fun(FName, Opts, Expected) ->
  540:                       Path = case FName of
  541:                                  "" -> "";
  542:                                  FName -> filename:join(SrcDir, FName)
  543:                              end,
  544:                       run(Config, Cmd, Path, Opts, Expected)
  545:               end,
  546:     {Compile, SrcDir, OutDir}.
  547: 
  548: %% Tests
  549: features_erlc_describe(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  550:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  551: 
  552:     Compile("", "-list-features",
  553:             ?NOTOK(["Available features:",
  554:                     "approved_ftr_1",
  555:                     "approved_ftr_2",
  556:                     "experimental_ftr_1",
  557:                     "experimental_ftr_2"])),
  558: 
  559:     Compile("", "-describe-feature experimental_ftr_1",
  560:             ?NOTOK(["experimental_ftr_1",
  561:                     "Type",
  562:                     "Status",
  563:                     "Keywords",
  564:                     skip_lines])),
  565: 
  566:     Compile("", "-describe-feature loop_macro",
  567:             ?NOTOK(["Unknown feature: loop_macro"])).
  568: 
  569: features_erlc_unknown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  570:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  571: 
  572:     %% Test for single invalid feature, using long and +options
  573:     Compile("nofile.erl", longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  574:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  575:     Compile("nofile.erl", plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  576:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  577:     Compile("nofile.erl", longopt(disable, no_ftr),
  578:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  579:     Compile("nofile.erl", plusopt(disable, no_ftr),
  580:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  581: 
  582:     %% Test for multiple invalid features
  583:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  584:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  585:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  586:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  587:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr),
  588:                                    longopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  589:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  590:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  591:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  592:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  593:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  594:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  595:                                    plusopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  596:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  597: 
  598:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  599:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  600:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  601:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  602:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  603:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  604: 
  605:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  606:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr),
  607:                                    plusopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  608:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  609:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  610:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  611:                                    plusopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  612:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  613: 
  614:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  615:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  616:                                    longopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  617:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  618:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  619:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  620:                                    longopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  621:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  622: 
  623:     %% Rejected and permanent features can not be configured.
  624:     %% Rejected feature
  625:     Compile("nofile.erl",
  626:             options([longopt(enable, rejected_ftr)]),
  627:             ?NOTOK([not_config(rejected_ftr),
  628:                     skip_lines])),
  629: 
  630:     %% Permanent feature
  631:     Compile("nofile.erl",
  632:             options([longopt(enable, permanent_ftr)]),
  633:             ?NOTOK([not_config(permanent_ftr),
  634:                     skip_lines])).
  635: 
  636: features_directives(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  637:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  638: 
  639:     %% Test for misplaced feature directive (enable)
  640:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  641:             options([defopt(misplaced_enable)]),
  642:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
  643:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature.*misplaced",
  644:                     skip_lines])),
  645:     %% Test for misplaced feature directive (disable)
  646:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  647:             options([defopt(misplaced_disable)]),
  648:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
  649:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature.*misplaced",
  650:                     skip_lines])),
  651: 
  652:     %% Test for unknown feature in directive (enable)
  653:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  654:             options([defopt(enable_unknown)]),
  655:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(unlesser),
  656:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature",
  657:                     skip_lines])),
  658:     %% Test for unknown feature in directive (disable)
  659:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  660:             options([defopt(disable_unknown)]),
  661:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(unlesser),
  662:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature",
  663:                     skip_lines])),
  664: 
  665:     %% Enable a feature on the command line and disable the same in a
  666:     %% directive
  667:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  668:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2),
  669:                      defopt(disable_exp2),
  670:                      defopt(no_dir_enable_exp2)]),
  671:             ?OK([])).
  672: 
  673: features_atom_warnings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  674:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  675: 
  676:     %% Check for keyword warnings.  Not all are checked.
  677:     Compile("ignorant.erl", "+warn_keywords",
  678:             ?OK([atom_warning(until, experimental_ftr_2),
  679:                  skip_lines,
  680:                  atom_warning(ifn, experimental_ftr_1),
  681:                  skip_lines,
  682:                  atom_warning(while, experimental_ftr_2),
  683:                  skip_lines])),
  684: 
  685:     %% Check for keyword warnings, resulting in error.
  686:     %% Not all warnings are checked.
  687:     Compile("ignorant.erl", "+warn_keywords -Werror",
  688:             ?NOTOK([skip_lines,
  689:                     atom_warning(until, experimental_ftr_2),
  690:                     skip_lines,
  691:                     atom_warning(ifn, experimental_ftr_1),
  692:                     skip_lines,
  693:                     atom_warning(while, experimental_ftr_2),
  694:                     skip_lines])),
  695: 
  696:     %% Check for keyword warnings.  Not all warnings are checked.
  697:     %% This file has a -compile attribute for keyword warnings.
  698:     Compile("ignorant_directive.erl", "",
  699:             ?OK([atom_warning(ifn, experimental_ftr_1),
  700:                  skip_lines,
  701:                  atom_warning(while, experimental_ftr_2),
  702:                  skip_lines,
  703:                  atom_warning(until, experimental_ftr_2),
  704:                  skip_lines])),
  705: 
  706:     %% Override warning attribute inside file
  707:     Compile("ignorant_directive.erl", "+nowarn_keywords",
  708:             ?OK([])),
  709: 
  710:     %% File has quoted atoms which are keywords in experimental_ftr_2.
  711:     %% We should see no warnings.
  712:     Compile("foo.erl", options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2),
  713:                                 "+warn_keywords"]),
  714:             ?OK([])).
  715: 
  716: features(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  717:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  718: 
  719:     %% Simple compile - baseline for this file.  Really needed?
  720:     %% It uses atoms that are keywords in  experimental features.
  721:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  722:             [],
  723:             ?OK([])),
  724: 
  725:     %% Enable and disable the same feature on the command line to
  726:     %% check that the ordering semantics is honoured.
  727:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  728:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  729:                      longopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  730:             ?OK([])),
  731: 
  732:     %% As above, with +options
  733:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  734:             options([plusopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  735:                      plusopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  736:             ?OK([])),
  737: 
  738:     %% Mixed options
  739:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  740:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  741:                      plusopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  742:             ?OK([])),
  743: 
  744:     %% Mixed options
  745:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  746:             options([plusopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  747:                      longopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  748:             ?OK([])),
  749: 
  750:     %% Enable a feature and see errors
  751:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  752:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  753:             ?NOTOK([syntax(ifn),
  754:                     skip_lines,
  755:                     syntax(ifn),
  756:                     skip_lines])),
  757: 
  758:     %% Enable another feature and see other errors
  759:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  760:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  761:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
  762:                     skip_lines,
  763:                     syntax(until),
  764:                     skip_lines,
  765:                     syntax(while),
  766:                     skip_lines,
  767:                     syntax(while),
  768:                     skip_lines,
  769:                     syntax(until),
  770:                     skip_lines])),
  771: 
  772:     %% Enable both features and see even more errors
  773:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  774:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  775:                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  776:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
  777:                     skip_lines,
  778:                     syntax(until),
  779:                     skip_lines,
  780:                     syntax(ifn),
  781:                     skip_lines,
  782:                     syntax(while),
  783:                     skip_lines,
  784:                     syntax(until),
  785:                     skip_lines,
  786:                     syntax(ifn),
  787:                     skip_lines])),
  788: 
  789:     ok.
  790: 
  791: features_macros(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  792:     {Compile, _, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  793: 
  794:     Compile("f_macros.erl", "", ?OK([])),
  795: 
  796:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  797:     Call = fun(Node, Fun) ->
  798:                    erpc:call(Node, f_macros, Fun, [])
  799:            end,
  800: 
  801:     {module, f_macros} =
  802:         erpc:call(Node0, code, load_file, [f_macros]),
  803: 
  804:     true = Call(Node0, has_experimental),
  805:     false = Call(Node0, has_hindley_milner),
  806:     false = Call(Node0, with_hm),
  807:     false = Call(Node0, uses_experimental),
  808:     false = Call(Node0, uses_exp2),
  809: 
  810:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  811: 
  812:     Compile("f_macros.erl", longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  813:             ?OK([])),
  814: 
  815:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  816: 
  817:     true = erpc:call(Node1, erlang, module_loaded, [erl_features]),
  818: 
  819:     %% We can't load this due to experimental_ftr_1 not being enabled
  820:     %% in the runtime
  821:     {error, {features_not_allowed, [experimental_ftr_1]}} =
  822:         erpc:call(Node1, code, load_file, [f_macros]),
  823:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  824:     [approved_ftr_1, approved_ftr_2, experimental_ftr_1] =
  825:         erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, used, [f_macros]),
  826: 
  827:     peer:stop(Peer1),
  828: 
  829:     %% Restart with feature enabled in runtime
  830:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  831:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_1"]),
  832:     %% Now we can load it
  833:     {module, f_macros} =
  834:         erpc:call(Node2, code, load_file, [f_macros]),
  835: 
  836:     true = Call(Node2, uses_experimental),
  837:     false = Call(Node2, uses_exp2),
  838:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  839: 
  840:     Compile("f_macros.erl", longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2),
  841:             ?OK([])),
  842:     {Peer3, Node3} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  843:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_2"]),
  844:     false = Call(Node3, uses_experimental),
  845:     true = Call(Node3, uses_exp2),
  846:     peer:stop(Peer3),
  847: 
  848:     Compile("f_macros.erl", options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  849:                                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  850:             ?OK([])),
  851:     {Peer4, Node4} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  852:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_1",
  853:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_2"]),
  854:     true = Call(Node4, uses_experimental),
  855:     true = Call(Node4, uses_exp2),
  856:     peer:stop(Peer4),
  857: 
  858:     ok.
  859: 
  860: features_disable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  861:     {Compile, _, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  862: 
  863:     Call = fun(Node, Fun) ->
  864:                    erpc:call(Node, f_disable, Fun, [])
  865:            end,
  866: 
  867:     Compile("f_disable.erl", options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  868:                                       longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  869:             ?OK([])),
  870: 
  871:     {Peer, Node} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  872:                          "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_1",
  873:                          "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_2"]),
  874:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  875:     [approved_ftr_2] =
  876:         erpc:call(Node, erl_features, used, [f_disable]),
  877: 
  878:     no_experimental = Call(Node, no_experimental),
  879:     no_exp2 = Call(Node, no_ftrs),
  880:     peer:stop(Peer),
  881: 
  882:     ok.
  883: 
  884: features_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  885:     {Compile, _, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  886: 
  887:     Compile("foo.erl", longopt(enable, all),
  888:             ?OK([])),
  889: 
  890:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  891:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  892:     [approved_ftr_1,approved_ftr_2,experimental_ftr_1,experimental_ftr_2] =
  893:         erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, [foo]),
  894:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  895: 
  896:     Compile("foo.erl", longopt(disable, all),
  897:             ?OK([])),
  898: 
  899:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  900:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  901:     [] = erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, used, [foo]),
  902:     {module, foo} = erpc:call(Node1, code, load_file, [foo]),
  903:     peer:stop(Peer1),
  904: 
  905:     Compile("foo.erl", options([longopt(disable, all),
  906:                                 longopt(enable, approved_ftr_2)]),
  907:             ?OK([])),
  908: 
  909:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  910:                            "-disable-feature", "all"]),
  911:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  912:     [approved_ftr_2] = erpc:call(Node2, erl_features, used, [foo]),
  913:     {error, {features_not_allowed, [approved_ftr_2]}} =
  914:         erpc:call(Node2, code, load_file, [foo]),
  915:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  916: 
  917:     ok.
  918: 
  919: features_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  920:     {_Compile, SrcDir, _OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  921: 
  922:     %% Note that we put SrcDir in the load path as there is where we
  923:     %% have the precompiled beam file.
  924:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", SrcDir]),
  925: 
  926:     %% For a file compiled with an older version, i.e., with no Meta
  927:     %% chunk, we should see no used features.
  928:     [] = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, [older]),
  929:     %% .. and we should be able to load it.
  930:     {module,older} = erpc:call(Node0, code, load_file, [older]),
  931: 
  932:     [] = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used,
  933:                    [filename:join(SrcDir, "older.beam")]),
  934: 
  935:     %% Behaviour for non existent modules
  936:     not_found = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, [none]),
  937:     not_found = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, ["none.beam"]),
  938:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  939: 
  940:     ok.
  941: 
  942: features_runtime(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  943:     AllFtrs = [approved_ftr_1,
  944:                approved_ftr_2,
  945:                experimental_ftr_1,
  946:                experimental_ftr_2,
  947:                permanent_ftr,
  948:                rejected_ftr],
  949:     ConfigFtrs = [approved_ftr_1,
  950:                   approved_ftr_2,
  951:                   experimental_ftr_1,
  952:                   experimental_ftr_2],
  953:     Approved = [approved_ftr_2,
  954:                 approved_ftr_1],
  955: 
  956:     {Compile, _SrcDir, _OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  957: 
  958:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer([]),
  959: 
  960:     %% Get all known features
  961:     AllFtrs = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, all, []),
  962:     ConfigFtrs = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, configurable, []),
  963:     Approved =  erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, enabled, []),
  964: 
  965:     %% Keywords from enabled (here the approved) features
  966:     %% (does not need to be quoted since it comes from the peer node)
  967:     [unless] =  erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, keywords, []),
  968: 
  969:     Info = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, info, [permanent_ftr]),
  970:     true = is_map(Info),
  971:     true = lists:all(fun(K) -> is_map_key(K, Info) end,
  972:                      [status,type,description,short,experimental]),
  973: 
  974:     %% Try to get info for unknown feature - raises error
  975:     try
  976:         erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, info, [unknown_feature]) of
  977:         Value ->
  978:             ct:fail({value_returned_for_unknown_feature, Value})
  979:     catch
  980:         error:{exception, invalid_feature, _} ->
  981:             ok;
  982:         Class:Reason ->
  983:             ct:fail({unexpected_exception, {Class, Reason}})
  984:     end,
  985: 
  986:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  987: 
  988:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-enable-feature", "experimental_ftr_2"]),
  989:     [experimental_ftr_2, approved_ftr_2, approved_ftr_1] =
  990:         erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, enabled, []),
  991:     [while, until, unless] =  erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, keywords, []),
  992: 
  993:     peer:stop(Peer1),
  994: 
  995:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-disable-feature", "all"]),
  996:     [] = erpc:call(Node2, erl_features, enabled, []),
  997:     [] =  erpc:call(Node2, erl_features, keywords, []),
  998: 
  999:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1000:     ok.
 1001: 
 1002: features_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1003:     {Compile, _SrcDir, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
 1004: 
 1005:     %% Ensure that the feature experimental_ftr_1 is enabled in the
 1006:     %% include file and generates an error
 1007:     Compile("f_include_1.erl", [],
 1008:             ?NOTOK([syntax(ifn),
 1009:                     skip_lines])),
 1010: 
 1011:     %% This will disable a feature after a record has been defined.
 1012:     %% Error expected
 1013:     Compile("f_include_1.erl", defopt(end_include),
 1014:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
 1015:                     skip_lines])),
 1016: 
 1017:     %% Ensure that the macro knows that experimental_ftr_1 is enabled
 1018:     %% in the include file.
 1019:     Compile("f_include_2.erl", defopt(end_include),
 1020:             ?OK([])),
 1021: 
 1022:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
 1023:                            "-enable-feature", "experimental_ftr_1"]),
 1024: 
 1025:     {module, f_include_2} = erpc:call(Node0, code, load_file, [f_include_2]),
 1026:     active = erpc:call(Node0, f_include_2, foo, [2]),
 1027:     peer:stop(Peer0),
 1028: 
 1029:     Compile("f_include_3.erl", [],
 1030:             ?OK([])),
 1031: 
 1032:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
 1033:                            "-enable-feature", "all"]),
 1034:     exp2_enabled = erpc:call(Node1, f_include_3, foo, [1]),
 1035:     peer:stop(Peer1),
 1036: 
 1037:     Compile("f_include_3.erl", defopt(end_prefix),
 1038:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
 1039:                     "experimental_ftr_2",
 1040:                     skip_lines])),
 1041: 
 1042:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl", defopt(enable_exp_2, 0),
 1043:             ?OK([])),
 1044:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
 1045:     {conditional, on, until} = erpc:call(Node2, f_include_exp2, foo, []),
 1046:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1047: 
 1048:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl",
 1049:             options([defopt(enable_exp_2, 0),
 1050:                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
 1051:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
 1052:                     skip_lines])),
 1053: 
 1054:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl",
 1055:             options([defopt(enable_exp_2, 1)]),
 1056:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
 1057:                     skip_lines])),
 1058: 
 1059:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl",
 1060:             options([defopt(enable_exp_2, 2),
 1061:                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
 1062:             ?OK([])),
 1063: 
 1064:     {Peer3, Node3} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
 1065:                            "-enable-feature", "experimental_ftr_2"]),
 1066:     {conditional, off, none} = erpc:call(Node3, f_include_exp2, foo, []),
 1067: 
 1068:     [approved_ftr_1, approved_ftr_2, experimental_ftr_2] =
 1069:         erpc:call(Node3, erl_features, used, [f_include_exp2]),
 1070:     peer:stop(Peer3),
 1071: 
 1072:     ok.
 1073: 
 1074: %% Runs a command.
 1075: 
 1076: run(Config, Cmd0, Name, Options, Expect) ->
 1077:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " " ++ Options ++ " " ++ Name,
 1078:     io:format("~ts", [Cmd]),
 1079:     Result = run_command(Config, Cmd),
 1080:     verify_result(Result, Expect).
 1081: 
 1082: verify_result(Result, Expect) ->
 1083:     Messages = split(Result, [], []),
 1084:     io:format("Result: ~p", [Messages]),
 1085:     io:format("Expected: ~p", [Expect]),
 1086:     match_messages_x(Messages, Expect).
 1087: 
 1088: %% insert What before Item, crash if Item is not found
 1089: insert_before(Item, What, [Item|List]) ->
 1090:     [What,Item|List];
 1091: insert_before(Item, What, [Other|List]) ->
 1092:     [Other|insert_before(Item, What, List)].
 1093: 
 1094: split([$\n|Rest], Current, Lines) ->
 1095:     split(Rest, [], [lists:reverse(Current)|Lines]);
 1096: split([$\r|Rest], Current, Lines) ->
 1097:     split(Rest, Current, Lines);
 1098: split([Char|Rest], Current, Lines) ->
 1099:     split(Rest, [Char|Current], Lines);
 1100: split([], [], Lines) ->
 1101:     lists:reverse(Lines);
 1102: split([], Current, Lines) ->
 1103:     split([], [], [lists:reverse(Current)|Lines]).
 1104: 
 1105: match_messages_x(Msgs0, Regexps0) ->
 1106:     Msgs = lists:droplast(Msgs0),
 1107:     Regexps = lists:droplast(Regexps0),
 1108:     Return = lists:last(Msgs0),
 1109:     ExpRet = lists:last(Regexps0),
 1110:     match_messages(Msgs, Regexps),
 1111:     match_one(Return, ExpRet).
 1112: 
 1113: match_messages(_, [skip_lines]) ->
 1114:     ok;
 1115: match_messages([_Msg|Rest1], [skip_one|Rest2]) ->
 1116:     match_messages(Rest1, Rest2);
 1117: match_messages([Msg|Rest1], [skip_lines, Regexp|Rest2]) ->
 1118:     case match(Msg, Regexp) of
 1119:         match ->
 1120:             match_messages(Rest1, Rest2);
 1121:         nomatch ->
 1122:             match_messages(Rest1, [skip_lines, Regexp|Rest2])
 1123:     end;
 1124: match_messages([Msg|Rest1], [Regexp|Rest2]) ->
 1125:     match_one(Msg, Regexp),
 1126:     match_messages(Rest1, Rest2);
 1127: match_messages([], [Expect|Rest]) ->
 1128:     ct:fail({too_few_messages, [Expect|Rest]});
 1129: match_messages([Msg|Rest], []) ->
 1130:     ct:fail({too_many_messages, [Msg|Rest]});
 1131: match_messages([], []) ->
 1132:     ok.
 1133: 
 1134: match_one(Msg, Regexp) ->
 1135:     case match(Msg, Regexp) of
 1136:         match ->
 1137:             ok;
 1138:         nomatch ->
 1139:             io:format("Not matching: ~s\n", [Msg]),
 1140:             io:format("Regexp      : ~s\n", [Regexp]),
 1141:             ct:fail(message_mismatch)
 1142:     end.
 1143: 
 1144: match(Msg, Regexp) ->
 1145:     re:run(Msg, Regexp, [{capture,none}, unicode]).
 1146: 
 1147: get_cmd(Cfg) ->
 1148:     {SrcDir, IncDir, OutDir} = get_dirs(Cfg),
 1149:     Cmd = erlc() ++ " -I" ++ IncDir ++ " -o" ++ OutDir ++ " ",
 1150:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd}.
 1151: 
 1152: get_dirs(Cfg) ->
 1153:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Cfg),
 1154:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Cfg),
 1155:     SrcDir = filename:join(DataDir, "src"),
 1156:     IncDir = filename:join(DataDir, "include"),
 1157:     {SrcDir, IncDir, PrivDir}.
 1158: 
 1159: exists(Name) ->
 1160:     filelib:is_file(Name).
 1161: 
 1162: %% Runs the command using os:cmd/1.
 1163: %%
 1164: %% Returns the output from the command (as a list of characters with
 1165: %% embedded newlines).  The very last line will indicate the
 1166: %% exit status of the command, where _OK_ means zero, and _ERROR_
 1167: %% a non-zero exit status.
 1168: 
 1169: run_command(Config, Cmd) ->
 1170:     TmpDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "tmp"),
 1171:     file:make_dir(TmpDir),
 1172:     {RunFile, Run, Script} = run_command(TmpDir, os:type(), Cmd),
 1173:     ok = file:write_file(RunFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(Script)),
 1174:     os:cmd(Run).
 1175: 
 1176: run_command(Dir, {win32, _}, Cmd) ->
 1177:     BatchFile = filename:join(Dir, "run.bat"),
 1178:     Run = re:replace(filename:rootname(BatchFile), "/", "\\",
 1179:                      [global,{return,list}]),
 1180:     {BatchFile,
 1181:      Run,
 1182:      ["@echo off\r\n",
 1183:       "set ERLC_EMULATOR=", ct:get_progname(), "\r\n",
 1184:       Cmd, "\r\n",
 1185:       "if errorlevel 1 echo _ERROR_\r\n",
 1186:       "if not errorlevel 1 echo _OK_\r\n"]};
 1187: run_command(Dir, {unix, _}, Cmd) ->
 1188:     Name = filename:join(Dir, "run"),
 1189:     {Name,
 1190:      "/bin/sh " ++ Name,
 1191:      ["#!/bin/sh\n",
 1192:       "ERLC_EMULATOR='", ct:get_progname(), "'\n",
 1193:       "export ERLC_EMULATOR\n",
 1194:       Cmd, "\n",
 1195:       "case $? in\n",
 1196:       "  0) echo '_OK_';;\n",
 1197:       "  *) echo '_ERROR_';;\n",
 1198:       "esac\n"]};
 1199: run_command(_Dir, Other, _Cmd) ->
 1200:     ct:fail("Don't know how to test exit code for ~p", [Other]).
